title: How Trump Changed His Tone on Putin and the Russia-Ukraine War
summary: After years of lavishing praise on the Russian leader, President Trump abruptly changed his posture amid mounting frustration with the lack of progress on a cease-fire.

title: Zelensky Announces Plan for Major Government Shake-Up in Ukraine
summary: An announcement by the Ukrainian president that he will seek to replace the prime minister with a loyalist came as the country faces battlefield setbacks and a souring mood.

title: The Economy Has Been Resilient. The New Round of Tariffs May Hit Harder.
summary: The economy’s resilience so far to President Trump’s global trade war risks emboldening him and unleashing the sort of economic devastation that economists have long feared.

title: It’s No Bluff: The Tariff Rate Is Soaring Under Trump
summary: The president has earned a reputation for bluffing on tariffs. But he has steadily and dramatically raised U.S. tariffs, transforming global trade.

title: Companies in Europe Are Frozen as Tariff Uncertainty Drags On
summary: After European Union leaders said they would keep negotiating instead of immediately retaliating against President Trump’s latest threat, businesses remain unable to develop long-term plans.

title: Bitcoin Price Soars Past $120,000 at Outset of House’s ‘Crypto Week’
summary: The cryptocurrency has extended its rally as lawmakers consider legislation that would bring digital tokens further into the mainstream.

title: Cuomo Will Stay in the Race for N.Y.C. Mayor to Challenge Mamdani
summary: Former Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo is expected to announce his commitment to a third-party run against Assemblyman Zohran Mamdani, who soundly defeated him in the Democratic primary.

title: Plan to Indefinitely Displace Palestinians Threatens to Derail Gaza Truce
summary: An Israeli proposal to force much of Gaza’s population into a small enclave is now overshadowing negotiations over a truce.

title: Clashes between Bedouin and Druse in Syria Kill More Than 50, Health Official and Rights Group Say
summary: The violence underscores the government’s challenge to assert nationwide control as ethnic and religious tensions simmer after the end of the civil war.

title: Facing Painful Cuts, the V.A. Reported Dubious Savings to DOGE
summary: The Department of Veterans Affairs claimed credit for canceling contracts that had not been canceled, and tallied savings unrelated to the cost-cutting efforts.

title: He Helped Big Companies Dodge Taxes. Now He’s Writing the Rules.
summary: Ken Kies, a longtime tax lobbyist who worked for some of the world’s largest businesses, is now running the Treasury Department’s office that will administer Trump’s tax law.

title: Inside the Conservative Campaign That Took Down a University President
summary: The Jefferson Council had called for eliminating D.E.I., without much success. But a new lawyer with ties to the group took on the cause for the Trump administration.

title: NPR and PBS Face Federal Funding Cuts: What to Know
summary: A proposal before the Senate to strip funding from the Corporation for Public Broadcasting could be catastrophic for local stations, particularly those in rural areas.

title: Meta Built a Data Center Next Door. The Neighbors’ Water Taps Went Dry.
summary: In the race to develop artificial intelligence, tech giants are building data centers that guzzle up water. That has led to problems for people who live nearby.

title: The Tooth Fairy Is Real. She’s a Dentist in Seattle.
summary: For 20 years, Dr. Purva Merchant has been answering letters from gaptoothed children and their parents — roughly 6,000 in all. “Happy growing up,” she typically replies.

title: Footage of Inmate Suicide Captures Dysfunction on Rikers Island
summary: The New York Times has obtained video of the 2022 death of Michael Nieves, a mentally ill detainee who mortally wounded himself on Rikers Island.

title: Apollo-Soyuz 50th Anniversary: A Handshake in Orbit That Transformed the Space Race
summary: The Apollo-Soyuz Test Project brought Soviet cosmonauts and NASA astronauts together in the first international human spaceflight.

title: Texan Stoicism Provides Comfort, and Excuses, After the Flood
summary: Texans often draw on the idea of their own self-reliance during times of adversity. Gov. Greg Abbott has used it to deflect tough questions.

title: Texas Floods: Death Toll, Map and What to Know
summary: The search for the missing will resume on Monday after heavy rainfall slowed efforts the previous day. Roughly 170 people remain unaccounted for.

title: Living ‘A Day Without a Mexican’ in L.A., 21 Years Later
summary: The 2004 indie film imagined an absurd, Latino-less California. As fears of immigration raids empty out parts of Los Angeles, the film’s premise feels all too real, its creators say.

title: America Is Unraveling Its Safety Net
summary: America is unraveling its safety net.

title: Governors Should Be the Face of the Democratic Party
summary: The state leaders may be the party’s best shot at reconnecting with the American people.

title: Protests in Kenya
summary: How the unrest began — and what may happen next.

title: Nine People Killed in Fire at Massachusetts Assisted Living Facility
summary: The fire broke out on Sunday in the city of Fall River, a state official said. More than 30 residents were taken to the hospital.

title: How Long Can China Keep Propping Up Its Consumers With Subsidies?
summary: Shoppers are taking advantage of a $42 billion government trade-in program aimed at boosting spending. But in recent weeks, some cities have started to cut back on the subsidies.

title: Scotland’s Unreliable Ferries Leave People on Islands in Outer Hebrides Cut Off
summary: With aging ferries delayed sometimes for days, life goes haywire on an island in the Outer Hebrides.

title: Tesla Faces First Jury Trial Tied to Its Autopilot System
summary: The case stems from a fatal accident in 2019 involving a Tesla Model S sedan. Previous cases involving Autopilot had been settled or dismissed.
